intro: Cyclosorus paracuminatus, commonly known as the small red fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in diameter. The leaves are usually red or reddish in color, which distinguishes it from other members of the genus. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. This plant plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen through photosynthesis.
